title: David Walliams Dropped from Book Festival
summary: David Walliams is a famous author who writes books for kids. He was supposed to go to a book festival next year, but he has been dropped from it. This happened because some people said he acted inappropriately towards young women. The festival is run by Waterstones, a big book store. Walliams says he did not do anything wrong and is getting legal help. Other authors like Cressida Cowell and Liz Pichon will still go to the festival. Walliams has sold many books, like Gangsta Granny, and some have been made into TV shows. His publisher, HarperCollins, also stopped working with him recently. The festival will happen in three places: Dundee, Lincoln, and Taunton.

background_read: David Walliams is a well-known children's author in the UK who has written popular books like Gangsta Granny and Billionaire Boy. He started writing kids' books in 2008 with The Boy in the Dress. His books have sold over 60 million copies and been translated into many languages. Some of his stories have been made into TV films shown on channels like CBBC. Book festivals are events where authors meet readers, sign books, and talk about their work. Waterstones is a big chain of bookstores in Britain that organizes such festivals to promote reading and books for children.
Article_Structure: WHO: David Walliams, a famous children's author, and Waterstones, a book store.
WHAT: Walliams was dropped from a book festival due to allegations of inappropriate behaviour.
WHERE: The festival will be in Dundee, Lincoln, and Taunton in the UK.
WHY: Because of claims against him, which he denies, and his publisher cut ties.

Others might believe Walliams should be allowed to go since he says he didn't do anything wrong.
